items.title: France in fresh political crisis after MPs oust prime minister
items.standfirst: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.
items.content: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.

items.title: French government collapses as prime minister is ousted
items.standfirst: France's President Emmanuel Macron must search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months after Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted.
items.content: France's President Emmanuel Macron must search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months after Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted.

items.title: French government collapses as PM François Bayrou loses confidence vote
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron will look for a replacement who can break the budget impasse
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron will look for a replacement who can break the budget impasse

items.title: François Bayrou ousted as French PM after losing confidence vote
items.standfirst: Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after only nine months as prime minister, collapsing his minority government and plunging France into a political crisis.Bayrou, 74, will hand his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, his longterm centrist ally, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...
items.content: Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after only nine months as prime minister, collapsing his minority government and plunging France into a political crisis.Bayrou, 74, will hand his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, his longterm centrist ally, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...

items.title: French Prime Minister François Bayrou ousted after losing confidence vote
items.standfirst: France's Prime Minister François Bayrou overwhelmingly lost a confidence vote Monday after nine months in office. CBS News correspondent Shanelle Kaul has more.
items.content: France's Prime Minister François Bayrou overwhelmingly lost a confidence vote Monday after nine months in office. CBS News correspondent Shanelle Kaul has more.

items.title: French government collapses after PM Bayrou ousted in confidence vote
items.standfirst: French Parliament votes to bring down the Bayrou-led government over its plans to cut about $52bn to reduce the debt.
items.content: French Parliament votes to bring down the Bayrou-led government over its plans to cut about $52bn to reduce the debt.

items.title: France's government collapses after the prime minister loses a confidence vote
items.standfirst: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.
items.content: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.(Image credit: Christophe Ena)

items.title: Why has the French PM had to go and what happens next?
items.standfirst: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.
items.content: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.

items.title: France's ruling government collapses in major blow to President Emmanuel Macron
items.standfirst: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.
items.content: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.

items.title: French PM loses confidence vote - as country's political crisis deepens
items.standfirst: France's prime minister has failed in a last-minute bid to save his job, with the country's National Assembly ousting him in a confidence vote.
items.content: France's prime minister has failed in a last-minute bid to save his job, with the country's National Assembly ousting him in a confidence vote.

ai_summary: French Prime Minister François Bayrou lost a confidence vote after nine months in office.
The government's collapse necessitates President Macron finding a fourth prime minister in a year.
Bayrou will resign, handing his resignation to President Macron on Tuesday morning.
The confidence vote was 364 against and 194 in favor of the government.
The government's plans to cut about $52 billion in debt were a factor.

clusters.title: At least 17 reportedly killed amid protest over Nepal social media ban
clusters.neutral_headline: Nepal Protests Turn Deadly Over Social Media Ban
bullet_summary: Protesters demonstrating against Nepal's ban on many popular social media platforms clashed with police outside the parliament, reportedly leaving at least 17 people dead
At least fourteen people were killed and dozens injured in Nepal’s Kathmandu during protests against the government’s decision to ban several social media platforms, local media reported

items.content: ‘Gen Z’ demonstrators took to the streets and stormed parliament amid anger over a social media ban and corruption.

items.title: At least 19 killed in ‘gen Z’ protests against Nepal’s social media ban
items.standfirst: Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.The government has faced mounting criticism after imposing a ban on 26 prominent social media platforms and messaging apps last week because they had missed a deadline to register under new regulations. Continue reading...

items.title: Nepal Sees Deadly Clashes as Protests Erupt on Social Media Ban
items.standfirst: At least fourteen people were killed and dozens injured in Nepal’s Kathmandu during protests against the government’s decision to ban several social media platforms, local media reported.
items.content: At least fourteen people were killed and dozens injured in Nepal’s Kathmandu during protests against the government’s decision to ban several social media platforms, local media reported.

items.title: At least 19 dead in Nepal protests over social media ban
items.standfirst: At least 19 people have been killed in Nepal as protesters clashed with police over a government decision to block 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, X and YouTube.
items.content: At least 19 people have been killed in Nepal as protesters clashed with police over a government decision to block 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, X and YouTube.

ai_summary: Protests against Nepal's social media ban and corruption resulted in at least 19 deaths.
Demonstrators stormed parliament amid anger over the social media restrictions.
The government banned dozens of online platforms for missing registration deadlines.
Protesters are demanding the government lift the social media ban and address corruption.
Hundreds of people were injured during the protests and the authorities' response.

items.title: Israel vows retaliation over deadly Jerusalem shooting
items.standfirst: Israeli authorities vowed retaliation after two gunmen from the occupied West Bank killed six people at a bus stop in Jerusalem on Monday. The shooting — one of the deadliest attacks in Israel since Oct. 7, 2023 — prompted Israeli leaders to vow to step up raids in the West Bank, as Israel plans…

items.title: Palestinian gunmen kill six people at Jerusalem bus stop
items.standfirst: At least 12 others injured in attack at Ramot intersection during morning rush hourPalestinian gunmen opened fire at a crowded bus stop in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem on Monday, killing six people and injuring 12 others before being shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian at the scene.The victims included a 79-year-old former cardiologist, a 43-year-old rabbi and a 25-year-old who had recently emigrated from Spain. Twenty-six others suffered injuries, including six who were left in a serious condition with gunshot wounds. Continue reading...
items.content: At least 12 others injured in attack at Ramot intersection during morning rush hourPalestinian gunmen opened fire at a crowded bus stop in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem on Monday, killing six people and injuring 12 others before being shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian at the scene.The victims included a 79-year-old former cardiologist, a 43-year-old rabbi and a 25-year-old who had recently emigrated from Spain. Twenty-six others suffered injuries, including six who were left in a serious condition with gunshot wounds. Continue reading...

items.content: Six people were killed in a shooting attack by suspected Palestinian gunmen at a bus stop in occupied East Jerusalem.

items.title: Gunmen kill at least six people at Jerusalem bus stop
items.standfirst: Two gunmen opened fire at a Jerusalem bus stop, killing at least six people and critically injuring seven others, emergency services said. The two attackers were “neutralized,” the police said. Hamas hailed the attack as "heroic" but did not claim responsibility.
items.content: Two gunmen opened fire at a Jerusalem bus stop, killing at least six people and critically injuring seven others, emergency services said. The two attackers were “neutralized,” the police said. Hamas hailed the attack as "heroic" but did not claim responsibility.

items.content: Two gunmen boarded a bus on the outskirts of Jerusalem at rush hour and shot dead six people in one of the deadliest attacks the city has seen in recent times.

ai_summary: Palestinian gunmen killed six people at a Jerusalem bus stop.
Two gunmen were shot dead at the scene by an off-duty soldier and a civilian.
The attack occurred in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem during rush hour.
Hamas hailed the attack as "heroic" but did not claim responsibility.
Twelve others were injured, with six in serious condition from gunshot wounds.

clusters.title: Details on alleged Trump message for Epstein, Trump's denial

items.title: Details on alleged Trump message for Epstein, Trump's denial

items.content: A birthday message allegedly written by President Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was released by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Monday. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.

items.title: House releases Trump's alleged birthday message to Jeffrey Epstein
items.standfirst: The Republican-led House Oversight Committee received materials Monday from convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a birthday book containing an explicit message allegedly from President Trump to Epstein. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. Barry Levine, author of the book "The Spider: Inside the Criminal Web of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell," joined CBS News to discuss.
items.content: The Republican-led House Oversight Committee received materials Monday from convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a birthday book containing an explicit message allegedly from President Trump to Epstein. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. Barry Levine, author of the book "The Spider: Inside the Criminal Web of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell," joined CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Murdoch family reaches deal to resolve succession fight over media empire
items.standfirst: Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of businessThe succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling media empire that includes Fox News, The Wall Street Journal and The Times in the UK, with his three oldest siblings receiving an estimated $1.1bn each for their shares in the business. Continue reading...
items.content: Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of businessThe succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling media empire that includes Fox News, The Wall Street Journal and The Times in the UK, with his three oldest siblings receiving an estimated $1.1bn each for their shares in the business. items.standfirst: Over the past year, Meta has blanketed TV screens around the world with commercials touting the privacy of Whatsapp, its encrypted messenger with a monthly user base of 3 billion people. “It’s private,” one ad campaign featuring the former cast of the Modern Family TV show says. “On Whatsapp, no…
items.content: Over the past year, Meta has blanketed TV screens around the world with commercials touting the privacy of Whatsapp, its encrypted messenger with a monthly user base of 3 billion people. “It’s private,” one ad campaign featuring the former cast of the Modern Family TV show says. “On Whatsapp, no…

items.title: Former WhatsApp security boss in lawsuit likens Meta’s culture to a “cult”
items.standfirst: Meta allegedly prioritized user growth over security, lawsuit said.
items.content: Over the past year, Meta has blanketed TV screens around the world with commercials touting the privacy of Whatsapp, its encrypted messenger with a monthly user base of 3 billion people. “It’s private,” one ad campaign featuring the former cast of the Modern Family TV show says. “On Whatsapp, no one can see or hear your personal messages … not even us,” a different series of ads declares. “Serious risks to user data” On Monday, the former head of security for the Meta-owed messaging app filed a federal whistleblower lawsuit that tells a far different narrative. The suit, filed in US District Court for the District of Northern California, recites a litany of purported security and privacy flaws that Meta not only didn’t fix after becoming aware of them, but also kept secret, allegedly in violation of a $5 billion settlement then-Whatsapp parent company Facebook reached with the Federal Trade Commission. The complaint was filed by Attaullah Baig, who became head of WhatsApp security in 2021.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: A former WhatsApp security boss is suing Meta.
The lawsuit likens Meta's culture to a "cult".
The suit alleges Meta prioritized user growth over security.
Meta has been running ads touting WhatsApp privacy.
The ads feature the former cast of the Modern Family TV show.

Klarna’s $14 Billion Valuation Draws Out FinTech Bargain Hunters
items.standfirst: Investors are snapping up orders for Klarna Group Plc shares ahead of its much-anticipated pricing debut late Tuesday. Part of the appeal: the buy-now-pay-later lender’s implied market valuation is currently about a 50% discount to rival Affirm Holdings Inc.

items.title: Intel’s Tan Appoints New Leaders for Data Center, PC Chip Groups
Intel’s Tan Appoints New Leaders for Data Center, PC Chip Groups
items.standfirst: Intel Corp., the computer-chip maker that has been struggling to revive its fortunes, appointed new leaders for its two biggest product groups and said Michelle Johnston Holthaus, a veteran executive previously in charge of the units, is leaving the company.
items.content: Intel Corp., the computer-chip maker that has been struggling to revive its fortunes, appointed new leaders for its two biggest product groups and said Michelle Johnston Holthaus, a veteran executive previously in charge of the units, is leaving the company.

Intel is trying to revive its fortunes.

clusters.title: Pope Leo canonizes 'God's influencer,' the Catholic Church's first millennial saint
clusters.neutral_headline: Pope Leo Canonizes Carlo Acutis as First Millennial Saint
bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, BBC World

items.title: Pope Leo canonizes 'God's influencer,' the Catholic Church's first millennial saint
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV declared 15-year-old Carlo Acutis the first millennial saint at an open-air Mass attended by tens of thousands of people in the Vatican’s St. Peter’s Square on Sunday. NBC News’ Claudio Lavanga reports at the Vatican.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV declared 15-year-old Carlo Acutis the first millennial saint at an open-air Mass attended by tens of thousands of people in the Vatican’s St. Peter’s Square on Sunday. NBC News’ Claudio Lavanga reports at the Vatican.
